content.question:
Figure 1 represents part of a process essential to gene expression.

Figure 1. Model of process involved in gene expression.

Which of the following best explains what strand <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> represents?

choices.label: A complementary <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sequence, because it contains thymine

The coding strand in this process, because it is being read <math alttext="3 prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="5 prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>
The antisense strand, because it is serving as a template

The pre‑<math alttext="m R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because it does not yet have a <math alttext="G T P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GTP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> cap

content.answer: The antisense strand, because it is serving as a template

skill.text: 2.B: Explain relationships between characteristics of biological models in both theoretical and applied contexts.
